textBox.richText: New Listing In West Wash Park! This remodeled Victorian sits on a fabulous corner lot near to both the outdoor amenities of Washington Park and the restaurants and shops of South Broadway. Featuring some of the best of urban outdoor living, including a bright, welcoming front porch and garden enclosed with a sandstone retaining wall and wrought iron fence. The backyard enclave is private and warm with room for a fire pit and dining space. The three bedrooms are all generous in size and have walk-in closets. Tall ceilings and a smart floor plan make this home perfect for modern living while preserving historic charm. Click Here for Tour and Pictures of 105 S Sherman Founder of Forsalebyowner.com has realtor to sell home! I can’t resist this one! The Wall Street Journal reported on August 3rd that the one-time CEO and Founder of Forsalebyowner.com had to use a realtor to sell his home after several months of unsuccessful efforts to sell it himself. Score one for the industry! Cheaper to Buy? Denver is one of 74% of cities where it is now cheaper to buy than to rent, according to CNN Money. Using Trulia.com data, the report analyzed unoccupied 2 bedroom condos, town homes and apartments. The average rent in Denver at $915, while a mortgage payment for a similar property is about $730/month - not included property taxes. Easy Math! Denver Market Report Home sales are remaining on an even keel, but a slight increase in sales has shown a fragile, but consistent raise in home prices which is likely to continue. Condo sales are now distinctly exceeding inventory and have been for a few weeks. While it’s still a buyer’s market, home prices have been increasing Metro Denver Home Sale Statistics- JULY 2011
